intro: Buchnera bilabiata, commonly known as the two-lipped buchnera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-lipped flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. Buchnera bilabiata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
